New pandemic alert? BRZ batCoV discovered in Brazil’s moustached bats
description: Scientists found a new coronavirus in Brazilian bats, named BRZ batCoV. This virus shares a genetic feature with SARS-CoV-2, the virus causing COVID-19. This discovery suggests important viral mutations can occur naturally. Researchers found no evidence of human infection. The finding highlights the need for wildlife surveillance in under-sampled regions.

'SM18': Palash Muchhal's tattoo for Smriti Mandhana breaks the internet - See pic
description: Smriti Mandhana led India to their maiden ICC Women's World Cup title in 2025, with boyfriend Palash Muchhal celebrating her historic win. Muchhal showcased his support with a "SM18" tattoo, as Mandhana's stellar performance, including crucial innings and a significant opening stand in the final, secured India's victory. The couple is reportedly planning to marry in November.

description: The New York Rangers showed remarkable compassion before their game against the Seattle Kraken. Comforting defenseman Brandon Montour after his brother passed from ALS. The heartfelt moment, led by Adam Fox. This highlighted the human side of hockey. By proving that respect and empathy can transcend team colors. Even in one of the NHL’s most competitive settings.

Shocking! Cricket league featuring Gayle, Praveen Kumar in chaos after organisers flee
description: The Indian Heaven Premier League (IHPL) in Jammu and Kashmir has collapsed, with organizers reportedly fleeing overnight, leaving behind unpaid bills and stranded players. International stars like Chris Gayle headlined the short-lived tournament, which aimed to boost local cricket and tourism but suffered from low turnout and sponsor withdrawal.

title: ‘Only 9 of 37 monitors worked on Diwali’: SC slams agencies over Delhi air gaps
description: The Supreme Court expressed concern over non-functional air quality monitoring stations in Delhi during Diwali, highlighting the need for proactive measures. The court directed the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) to file an affidavit detailing steps to prevent pollution from reaching severe levels, emphasizing pre-emptive actions over reactive ones.

title: 5 places where you can experience ice hotels and igloo stays
India’s hiring shift: Experience matters; degrees alone no longer guarantee jobs
description: Indian students are shifting focus from mere degrees to demonstrable skills as employers prioritize practical experience.  Companies are actively collaborating with universities to co-design curricula and build talent pipelines.  Apprenticeship programs are experiencing a significant resurgence, offering students hands-on learning and a faster entry into the workforce.  This marks a crucial mindset reset for the nation's talent ecosystem.

title: Maharashtra reserves 70 pc jobs in district cooperative banks for locals

China denies testing nukes: Beijing rejects Trump's claim; has advise for US
description: China has vehemently denied US President Donald Trump's claims of secret nuclear weapons tests, reaffirming its commitment to a moratorium and peaceful development.  Trump alleged that China and Russia were conducting underground tests, suggesting the US should resume its own. However, US Energy Secretary Chris Wright clarified any potential US tests would be non-critical system checks, not actual detonations.

title: Taylor Swift–Brittany Mahomes bond stays strong despite political divide
description: Taylor Swift and Brittany Mahomes have forged a strong friendship amidst the NFL spotlight, navigating differing political views that have sparked public speculation. Despite these differences, their bond, strengthened by shared experiences and mutual respect, highlights a genuine connection that transcends online noise and political divides.

title: UPI rush: Record Rs 27.3L cr transferred digitally in Oct; 20.7bn transactions done
description: UPI transactions reached an all-time high of Rs 27.28 lakh crore in October, with 20.7 billion transactions, driven by festive shopping. This surge highlights India's robust digital infrastructure and its growing dominance in global real-time payments, now powering 85% of domestic digital transactions.

BJP MP Ravi Kishan echoed this sentiment, predicting Gandhi would receive fewer votes than the fish he caught. Gandhi participated in a traditional fish-catching ritual in Begusarai.

Two victims remain in critical condition after the incident, which prompted an increased police presence on the rail network. Authorities have confirmed the attack is not being treated as terrorism.

The truck, moving at high speed, lost control near Lohamandi, causing widespread panic and chaos. Emergency services responded swiftly to rescue and aid the injured.

description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath likened Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, RJD's Tejashwi Yadav, and SP's Akhilesh Yadav to Mahatma Gandhi's "three monkeys" during a rally in Bihar. He accused them of being blind, deaf, and mute to the state's development and of colluding with mafias. Congress responded by stating Adityanath insulted Lord Hanuman with his remarks.

He has not yet received NHS psychiatric care and his family's business has collapsed. Ramesh finds Air India's interim compensation inadequate for his needs.

description: India's women's cricket team has achieved a historic maiden World Cup victory, sparking a massive 456.5% surge in conversations on X (formerly Twitter) within 24 hours. The nation erupted in celebration after the team's dominant performance against South Africa. This monumental win, lauded by figures like Virat Kohli, Sundar Pichai, and Satya Nadella, marks a new era for women's cricket in India and inspires future generations.

Trump claims Pakistan among nations conducting nuclear tests, defends US’ decision to resume testing- Key takeaways from his interview
'Pakistan conducting nuclear tests': Trump makes big claim
description: US President Donald Trump claimed Pakistan, Russia, China, and North Korea are conducting nuclear tests, justifying the US's decision to resume its own after over 30 years. He stated testing is necessary to ensure the reliability of American weapons systems, citing recent trials by Russia. Energy Secretary Chris Wright later clarified that discussions involved non-critical system tests, not full nuclear explosions.

title: 'Tipper collided, gravel fell on bus': 20 killed in T'gana; how tragic crash unfolded
Jalen’s girlfriend Draya responds to Travis’s ex Kayla after NBA star’s Halloween show
description: Kayla Nicole's Halloween portrayal of Toni Braxton's "He Wasn't Man Enough" video sparked social media buzz, with fans interpreting it as a message to ex Travis Kelce.  The performance garnered praise from celebrities like Draya Michele, Angel Reese, and Claire Kittle, while fueling speculation about Nicole's past relationship with Kelce.

title: Mets tipped to sign $16M Braves star as Pete Alonso replacement before deadline
description: The New York Mets are eyeing Atlanta Braves slugger Marcell Ozuna as a potential replacement for Pete Alonso, whose future with the team is uncertain. Ozuna, a veteran power hitter, could fill a crucial gap in the Mets' lineup. The Braves' shift in DH strategy might make the three-time All-Star available, offering New York a surprising, yet impactful, solution.

title: Massive recall of atorvastatin: What you need to know if you take cholesterol drugs
description: Both generic atorvastatin and brand-name Lipitor contain the same active ingredient — atorvastatin calcium — and are considered bioequivalent by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The drug is the top-selling medication in the US, with over 115 million prescriptions written for more than 29 million Americans.

title: Taylor Swift worried about security as Travis Kelce focuses on new season
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS: Musk, Rogan talk about alien object; link it to The Tunguska Event
description: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting anomalous characteristics. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast, featuring Elon Musk, explored potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueled by astrophysicist Avi Loeb's claims of extraterrestrial origins for the comet.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment focused on Gianna
description: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.
